decoworld.protocol.accounts

Class AccountRequests

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.protocol.accounts.AccountRequests
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccountRequests.FetchUserRequest, AccountRequests.LoginRequest, AccountRequests.RegisterUserRequest, AccountRequests.UpdateUserRequest

    public abstract class AccountRequests
extends java.lang.Object
    AccountRequests is the abstract supertype for all account-related requests. These are requests that are sent from a client to the server. We are using a supertype to 1. enforce that all AccountRequests have a connection member object. 2. allow for easier routing on the server via RTTI of the supertype. The various types of AccountRequests should be defined as static nested classes that extend the supertype class. This ensures all AccountRequests message definitions are in a single place.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AccountRequests.FetchUserRequest
      FetchUserRequest is the message that will be sent from a client to the server when a client wishes to fetch a User model from the server.
      static class  AccountRequests.LoginRequest
      LoginRequest is the message that will be sent from a client to the server when a user makes a login attempt.
      static class  AccountRequests.RegisterUserError
      List of possible errors when attempting to process a registration request Needs to sit in the protocol as client and server both need to be able to reference the enums.
      static class  AccountRequests.RegisterUserRequest
      RegisterUserRequest is the message that will be sent from a client to the server when a user attempts to register as a new user.
      static class  AccountRequests.UpdateUserRequest
      UpdateUserRequest is the message that will be sent from a client to the server when a client wishes to update a User model on the server.
